member.name: T:Sudoku.Solving.AnalysisResult
member.summary: Provides an analysis result after a puzzle solved.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Solving.AnalysisResult.#ctor(Sudoku.Data.IReadOnlyGrid,System.String,System.Boolean,Sudoku.Data.IReadOnlyGrid,System.TimeSpan,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{Sudoku.Solving.TechniqueInfo},System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IBag{Sudoku.Data.IReadOnlyGrid})
member.summary: Initializes an instance with some information.
member.param: Indicates whether the puzzle has been solved.

summary.para: Indicates whether the puzzle has been solved.
If the puzzle has multiple solutions or no solution, this value will be always .
Indicates the maximum difficulty of the puzzle.

When the puzzle is solved by , the value will be the maximum value among all difficulty ratings in solving steps. If the puzzle has not been solved, or else the puzzle is solved by other solvers, this value will be always 20M.
Indicates the total difficulty rating of the puzzle.

When the puzzle is solved by , the value will be the sum of all difficulty ratings of steps. If the puzzle has not been solved, the value will be the sum of all difficulty ratings of steps recorded in . However, if the puzzle is solved by other solvers, this value will be 0.
Indicates the pearl difficulty rating of the puzzle, calculated during only by .
When the puzzle is solved, the value will be the difficulty rating of the first solving step. If the puzzle has not solved or the puzzle is solved by other solvers, this value will be always 0.
Indicates the pearl difficulty rating of the puzzle, calculated during only by .

When the puzzle is solved, the value will be the difficulty rating of the first step before the first one whose conclusion is . If the puzzle has not solved or solved by other solvers, this value will be 20.0M.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Solving.Manual.Alses.Als
member.summary: Provides an ALS with specified digits in a specified region.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Solving.Manual.Alses.Als._mask
member.summary: The internal mask of this data structure.
member.remarks: The mask consists of 23 bits. The lower 9 bits is used for representing all digits used. for example, the mask 259 (or in binary 0b100_000_011) represents an ALS holds digits { 1, 2, 9 }; the middle 9 bits means the relative positions in a region, while the higher 5 bits means which region this ALS lies on (Region indices 0..27 is no more than 5 bits used in binary). The last 9 bits are reserved for future considerations.

summary.para:
Encapsulates an exocet technique searcher. The pattern will be like:
.-------.-------.-------.
| B B E | E . . | E . . |
| . . E | Q . . | R . . |
| . . E | Q . . | R . . |
:-------+-------+-------:
| . . S | S . . | S . . |
| . . S | S . . | S . . |
| . . S | S . . | S . . |
:-------+-------+-------:
| . . S | S . . | S . . |
| . . S | S . . | S . . |
| . . S | S . . | S . . |
'-------'-------'-------'
Where:
BBase Cells.
Q1st Object Pair (Target cells pair 1).
R2nd Object Pair (Target cells pair 2).
SCross-line Cells.
EEscape Cells.

In the data structure, all letters will be used as the same one in this exemplar. In addition, if senior exocet, one of two target cells will lie on cross-line cells, and the lines of two target cells lying on cannot contain any base digits.

member.summary: Solve the puzzle with option.

The progress used for report the current state. If we don't need, the value should be assigned .
member.exception: Throws when the solver cannot solved due to wrong handling.

summary.para: Indicates whether the solver should check ALS cycles.
The value is in default case.
Indicates whether two ALSes can be overlapped with each other.
The value is in default case.
Indicates whether all ALSes shows highlight regions instead of cells.
The value is in default case.
Indicates whether the solver should check all technique information using the strict technique searchers order.

If the value is , all technique searchers will be enabled calculation in order. It ensures the strictness of difficulty rating that the maximum difficulty searched in one searcher should be no more than the minimum one searched in the searcher behind the previous one.

The value is in default case. In addition, if this value is , the option will be disabled. In other words, this option does not work while solving when the condition is satisfied. However, the time of calculation with this value will be much slower than that with the value is .
Indicates whether the solver should check the technique Almost Locked Quadruple (ALQ).
The value is in debug environment, and in release environment.

Indicates whether the solver will check the validity of the conclusions after searched them. If the conclusions eliminate the wrong digits or assign to the wrong cells, it will report the error (i.e. throw a ).

The value is in default case. If the value is , all conclusions will be checked before applying to the grid. The comparer is the solution grid. Computer does not know which conclusions are correct and which ones are incorrect. Therefore, the best plan is to compare to the solution grid. If not, the solver will not check the validity of all conclusions. In other words, the solver does not stop the searching until the grid is totally invalid (None of eliminations or assignments can be searched). However, unfortunately, the grid has no solution at present.
Indicates whether the solver will check the chain finally forms a continuous nice loop. If so, the structure may eliminate more candidates than those of normal AICs.
The value is in default case.
Indicates whether the solver should check Gurth's symmetrical placement at the initial grid.

The value is in default case. In addition, if the value is , the solver will check the symmetry of the grid at initial. If the grid is symmetrical grid, the solver will give you a hint about the technique of symmetrical placement. However, the hint will influence the difficulty rating during solving the puzzle. If the puzzle is so easy (in other words, the grid does not need check it), this option will make the difficulty rating of the puzzle much more higher than that when the option is . In addition, if the option is , this option will be ignored.
Indicates whether the solver will check head collision in searching for AICs.
If the value is , the searcher will search for AICs whose head nodes are same as tail nodes. In this case, the AIC will raise a conclusion that the head node is absolutely true.
The value is in default case.
Indicates whether the solver should check incomplete uniqueness patterns.
The value is in debug environment, and in release environment.
Indicates whether the solver should search for extended unique rectangles.
The value is in debug environment, and in release environment.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Solving.Manual.ManualSolver.EnableFullHouse

summary.para: Indicates whether the solver will record the step whose name or kind is full house.
The value is in default case.

member.remarks: Full houses are the techniques that used in a single region. When the specified region has only one empty cell, the full house will be found at this empty cell (the last value in this region).

summary.para: Indicates whether the solver enables the garbage collection after finished searching a technique whose searcher is high space-complexity.
This value is in default case.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Solving.Manual.ManualSolver.EnableLastDigit

summary.para: Indicates whether the solver will record the step whose name or kind is last digit.
The value is in default case.

member.remarks: Last digits are the techniques that used in a single digit. When the whole grid has 8 same digits, the last one will be always found and set in the last position, which is last digit.

summary.para: Indicates whether the solver will apply multiple technique usages at the same time if searched more than one technique. As for the option is , when searched more than one technique instance which holds a same difficulty, the searcher will apply them at the same time; however if the value is , the solver will apply all same techniques searched at the same time.
The value is in default case. If the value is , the solver will enable this mode to accelerate the running, but the applied techniques will be added much more than when the value is .
Indicates whether the solver will check templates before searching Hobiwan's fish.

The value is in default case. If the value is , the solver will check templates first, and get all possible eliminations for each digit. If the digit does not contain any elimination, the digit will not exist any fish.
Indicates whether the step accumulator only records template delete, and template set will not be in this collection (if necessary).
If the value is , and the solver has checked all template steps, only template deletes in these steps will be recorded into the step accumulator.
The value is in default case.
Indicates whether the searcher will save the shortest path in AICs only.
The value is in default case. If the value is , the searcher will check all chains had stored in the list and get the shortest one, but the speed is slow.
Indicates whether the solver will optimizes the applying order.
When the value is , the result to apply to the grid will be the one which has the minimum difficulty rating; otherwise, the applying step will be the first one of all steps being searched.
The value is in default case. If the value is , the option will be disabled.
Indicates whether the solver will record only one AIC when searched AICs that contain same head node and tail node, but different path.
The value is in default case. If the value is , the solver will save only one chain with the condition above, but the length of the chain may not be the shortest one.
Indicates whether the solver should order all technique searchers by its priority.

The value is in default case. In addition, if you enable the option , this option will be disabled because the solver will enable the function of count on all steps and get one with the minimum difficulty of them.
Indicates whether the solver should use extended BUG checker to searcher for all true candidates no matter how difficult the true candidates looking for.
The value is in debug environment, and in release environment.
Indicates whether the solver should check advanced eliminations during finding exocets.
The value is in default case.
Indicates what size of the Hobiwan's fish will be searched for.
The value is 3 in default case. The maximum value supporting is 7.
Indicates how many exo-fins in Hobiwan's fish will be searched for.
The value is 3 in default case.
Indicates how many endo-fins in Hobiwan's fish will be searched for.
The value is 1 in default case.
Indicates the number of nodes to be searched for in bowman bingos.

The value is 32 in default case. You can let this value be higher because this value take a little influence on the solver. However, each unique solution has more than 17 hints (given digits), which means you cannot set this value more than 64 (81 - 17 = 64).
Indicates the maximum length of a chain to search.
The value is 10 in default case.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Solving.Manual.ManualSolver.CheckRegularWingSize

summary.para: Indicates all regular wings with the size less than or equals to this specified value. This value should be between 3 and 5.
The value is 5 in default case.

member.remarks: In fact this value can be 9 at most (i.e. value >= 3 && value <= 9) theoretically.

summary.para: Indicates the max petals of death blossom to search.
The value is 5 in default case.

where the bit [0..56] is for 8 cells, the last 7 bits determine the pattern is a heptagon or a octagon. If the value is 127 (not available), the pattern will be a heptagon.
Due to the rendering engine, you have to check this file rather than the tip window.
